reporting-org.narrative: UK - Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

title.narrative: British Council - Indonesia - Newton Fund

description.narrative: The Newton Fund uses science and innovation partnerships to promote economic development and social welfare of partner countries.

The Newton Fund's primary objective is to reduce poverty by generating and putting into use knowledge and technology to address development challenges and advance development for the poorest people and countries. We will seek to maximise the practical impact of research and innovation to improve the lives and opportunities of the global poor. In achieving this we will grow the research and innovation capacity of developing countries, as well as contributing to the continued strength of the UK’s research and innovation system, and support our wider prosperity and global influence.

title.narrative: Professional development 2015

description.narrative: Series of workshop, training, dialogue, and other activities to develop and enhance capacity related to research governance and research dissemination.

The program aims to provide dialogue, insights and learning to the leading universities in Indonesia which promote Science and Technology in higher education to further improve its education management, research governance as well as stimulate partnership between university – industry – government in relation to research and innovation.

reporting-org.narrative: UK - Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

title.narrative: Professional development 2016

description.narrative: The program aims to provide dialogue, insights and learning to the leading universities in Indonesia which promote Science and Technology in higher education to further improve its education management, research governance as well as stimulate partnership between university - industry - government in relation to research and innovation.

This is the second year of involvement for the Newton Fund in this program. In 2015, the pilot project has served as an experimental model for further evaluation and improvement in sequel activities. The involvement of the Newton Fund for the pilot project was important in a way to ensure the balance of the needs of Indonesia and the interest of Rolls Royce as an industry. In 2016, the highlight will be on in-depth and continuous discussions for the road to UTC and how this model can be adapted in Indonesia as the realisation of the government-academics-industry links, which will significantly contribute to the enrichment of the research and innovation ecosystem in Indonesia.

reporting-org.narrative: UK - Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

title.narrative: PhD Scholarship 2017

description.narrative: Full PhD scholarship that will focus on the topic of Marine and Maritime research. The theme covers a wide variety of discipline from hard sciences and engineering to social sciences. Examples: shipbuilding, aquaculture, renewable energy, logistic, coastal communities, disaster management, etc.

The PhD programme facilitates the capacity building of individuals, and the building of sustainable, long-lasting links between UK and overseas institutions, through PhD scholarships, placements, and partnerships.
This activity will lead to an increase in skilled researchers in areas of focus who will be key to Indonesia’s economic development. This cohort of well-trained human resources will allow Indonesia to make efficient use of its marine and maritime potential through research and innovations in these focus areas.

reporting-org.narrative: UK - Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

title.narrative: Professional Development Education (PDE) – 2019 –research skills training - HoW to Write international Quality Publication (WoRQ) Workshop Series

description.narrative: WoRQ will increase quality of researchers’ submission to international Q1/Q2 journal. Researchers will have one-on-one slot with highly experienced UK experts where they will examine article closely and provide immediate feedback.

The training aims to increase capacity of indonesian researchers in international publication writing. It is hoped that high quality articles generated from the training will gain more international citations. The training align with government’s strategic efforts in increasing quality research and publication, and quality teaching.

title.narrative: Professional Development Education (PDE) – 2020 - research management and governance - Research Capacity Building Workshop Series

description.narrative: The workshop series will help increasing capacity of research sector in Indonesia. Topics could include: Research Management; International Publication; Managing IPRs and patent register

The program aims to provide dialogue, insights and learning to research and science sector in Indonesia and further promote UK excellence in science and innovation through building sustainable partnership between UK and Indonesia. The workshops will be designed for researchers and research managers.
